nodes.title: Feat/select
nodes.bodyText:
📝 Description

Add a Select Component to next-ui

💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):
It's not a breaking change
📝 Additional Information
This is just a proposal for now there is a lot of remaining work to get something usable.

commit.message:
:sparkles: [Feature] Select : first iteration of working select using react-stately

*
:sparkles: [Feature] Select : Example of select usage and working primite with react-stately
:bug: [Fix debugger] remove useless debugger
:sparkles: [Feature] remove react-aria and react-stately dependencies

nodes.body:
@amauryfischer is attempting to deploy a commit to the **NextUI** Team on [Vercel](https://vercel.com).

A member of the Team first needs to [authorize it](https://vercel.com/git/authorize?team=NextUI&type=github&job=%7B%22headInfo%22%3A%7B%22sha%22%3A%22eecf59f3cd7c92674cd4127f52af0c43729b8709%22%7D%2C%22id%22%3A%22QmaBwtshRKQc3FJRrDjqsaVhzQebpiksGxRUhmmuPPwcVW%22%2C%22org%22%3A%22nextui-org%22%2C%22prId%22%3A1012%2C%22repo%22%3A%22nextui%22%7D).

| :--- | :----- | :------ | :------- | :------ |
| **nextui-storybook** | ❌ Failed ([Inspect](https://vercel.com/nextui-org/nextui-storybook/24FD3x45zJVBvhmBCuHqbL85udPR)) |  |  | Jan 16, 2023 at 7:57AM (UTC) |

@jrgarciadev this is a first approach to get a Select on next-ui, as this is my first contribution, i supposed there is a lot to change before the PR will be accepted, i'm open to any comment ! :) feel free to review

@amauryfischer i think it might be better to use `react-aria` instead of `react-stately` since NextUI migrates to `react-aria`
https://github.com/orgs/nextui-org/projects/2/views/2?pane=issue&itemId=13762964

> @amauryfischer i think it might be better to use `react-aria` instead of `react-stately` since NextUI migrates to `react-aria` https://github.com/orgs/nextui-org/projects/2/views/2?pane=issue&itemId=13762964

@ShellarFX  `react-stately` is part of `react-aria`: https://react-spectrum.adobe.com/react-stately/index.html

> > @amauryfischer i think it might be better to use `react-aria` instead of `react-stately` since NextUI migrates to `react-aria` https://github.com/orgs/nextui-org/projects/2/views/2?pane=issue&itemId=13762964
> 
> @ShellarFX `react-stately` is part of `react-aria`: https://react-spectrum.adobe.com/react-stately/index.html

ohh okay, my bad, I think it’s okay then

@jrgarciadev  What is make to add this feature to library? How i can help this PR to main version
?

Hey @amauryfischer I appreciate the effort you put to send this PR, however as you might know we migrated from Stitches to TailwindCSS, here's the in-progress Select based on top of TailwindCSS and the new structure https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/pull/1313, Thanks!
@jrgarciadev No problem ! i love the new nextuiv2 and i'm glad to see that you worked on Select Feature :)

@@ -0,0 +1,45 @@
+import React from "react";
+
+import User from "../user";
+
+import Select from "./index";
+
+export const Default = () => (
+  <Select>
+    <Select.Option textValue="banane">Banane</Select.Option>
+    <Select.Option>Orange</Select.Option>
+    <Select.Option>Pomme</Select.Option>
+  </Select>
+);
+
+export const Bordered = () => (
+  <Select inputProps={{bordered: true}}>
+    <Select.Option>Banane</Select.Option>
+    <Select.Option>Orange</Select.Option>
+    <Select.Option>Pomme</Select.Option>
+  </Select>
+);
+export const Exotic = () => (
+  <Select inputProps={{bordered: true}}>
+    <Select.Option textValue="Amaury Fischer">
+      <User
+        name="Amaury Fischer"
+        src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E03AQE-DLIIEdQhCA/profile-displayphoto-shrink_100_100/0/1649493319975?e=1678924800&v=beta&t=Jff2k7A7m3cO2wWGiFCw1CG-MC3GyrQJXRETb23nWo4"
+      >
+        <User.Link href="https://nextui.org/">@amaufischer</User.Link>
+      </User>
+    </Select.Option>
+    <Select.Option textValue="Linh-dan Tran">
+      <User
+        name="Linh-dan Tran"
+        src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C5603AQFV-BEU-qlG_A/profile-displayphoto-shrink_100_100/0/1578136442382?e=1678924800&v=beta&t=5uj_qf7__BxWg96KZ2muQUonZBtgQTFlSdVqISKkY0Y"
+      >
+        <User.Link href="https://nextui.org/">@linhdantran</User.Link>
+      </User>
+    </Select.Option>
+  </Select>
+);
+export default {
+  title: "Other/Select",
+  component: Select,
+} as any;

@@ -0,0 +1,60 @@
+import {Item} from "react-stately";
+
+import {styled, VariantProps} from "../theme/stitches.config";
+
+export const StyledSelectMenu = styled("ul", {
+  $$dropdownItemHeight: "$space$13",
+  $$dropdownMenuPadding: "$space$4",
+  $$dropdownMenuWidth: "250px",
+  $$dropdownMenuMinWidth: "250px",
+  listStyle: "none",
+  position: "relative",
+  maxWidth: "$$dropdownMenuWidth",
+  minWidth: "$$dropdownMenuMinWidth",
+  width: "100%",
+  p: "$$dropdownMenuPadding",
+  m: 0,
+  outline: "none",
+});
+
+export const StyledSelectOption = styled(
+  "li",
+  {
+    $$dropdownItemPressedScale: 0.9,
+    transition: "all 100ms ease-out",
+    display: "flex",
+    alignItems: "center",
+    justifyContent: "space-between",
+    padding: "$space$4",
+    cursor: "pointer",
+    borderRadius: "$rounded",
+    $$dropdownItemBorderRadius: "$radii$sm",
+    br: "$$dropdownItemBorderRadius",
+    "&:hover": {
+      backgroundColor: "$gray100",
+    },
+    "&:active": {
+      transform: "scale($$dropdownItemPressedScale)",
+    },
+  },
+  {
+    variants: {
+      isSelected: {
+        true: {
+          backgroundColor: "$primary100",
+        },
+      },
+      isFocused: {
+        true: {
+          backgroundColor: "$gray100",
+        },
+      },
+      isDisabled: {
+        true: {
+          cursor: "not-allowed",
+          opacity: 0.5,
+        },
+      },
+    },
+  },
+);

nodes.title: fix: fix lag issues for card on chrome
nodes.bodyText:
Closes  #957
📝 Description
Fixing the cause for lag on chrome browsers whilst hardware acceleration is disabled.
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)
Chrome browsers use the filter: drop-shadow() property instead of box-shadow:  property for displaying the shadows in the Card component.
🚀 New behavior
Modified card.styles.ts to remove the default dropShadow for chrome, and made everything use boxShadow
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):
No
📝 Additional Information

  
    
    

    Card._.NextUI.-.Beautiful.fast.and.modern.React.UI.Library.-.Google.Chrome.2023-01-14.19-07-28.mp4

commit.message: Fixed lag issues for card on chrome

nodes.title: [FEATURE] Points Loader - points-shib
nodes.bodyText:
📝 Description

Added new type of loader with points.

It can be added with a label.
It can be added in a button.


🚀 New behavior

Please refer below previews of new loader:

Different sizes in Dark Mode.





Different sizes in Light Mode.





In a button



💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):

No Impact on users.

📝 Additional Information
Note: Reverted the default loader in Loading > Sizes

commit.message: [FEATURE] Points Loader - points-shib

nodes.title: fix: fix input cursor postposition #975
nodes.bodyText:
Closes #975
📝 Description

When value in the props has changed, selfValue will update in useEffect. But target.value is not equal selfValue and it will reset the value of input element causing the cursor postposition. So, controlledValue should use value instead of selfValue when isControlledComponent is true.

⛳️ Current behavior (updates)

Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying

🚀 New behavior

Please describe the behavior or changes this PR adds

💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):

📝 Additional Information

+This is a [Next.js](https://nextjs.org/) project bootstrapped with [`create-next-app`](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/tree/canary/packages/create-next-app).
+
+## Getting Started
+
+First, run the development server:
+
+```bash
+npm run dev
+# or
+yarn dev
+# or
+pnpm dev
+```
+
+Open [http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) with your browser to see the result.
+
+You can start editing the page by modifying `app/page.tsx`. The page auto-updates as you edit the file.
+
+[http://localhost:3000/api/hello](http://localhost:3000/api/hello) is an endpoint that uses [Route Handlers](https://beta.nextjs.org/docs/routing/route-handlers). This endpoint can be edited in `app/api/hello/route.ts`.
+
+This project uses [`next/font`](https://nextjs.org/docs/basic-features/font-optimization) to automatically optimize and load Inter, a custom Google Font.
+
+## Learn More
+
+To learn more about Next.js, take a look at the following resources:
+
+- [Next.js Documentation](https://nextjs.org/docs) - learn about Next.js features and API.
+- [Learn Next.js](https://nextjs.org/learn) - an interactive Next.js tutorial.
+
+You can check out [the Next.js GitHub repository](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/) - your feedback and contributions are welcome!
+
+## Deploy on Vercel
+
+The easiest way to deploy your Next.js app is to use the [Vercel Platform](https://vercel.com/new?utm_medium=default-template&filter=next.js&utm_source=create-next-app&utm_campaign=create-next-app-readme) from the creators of Next.js.
+
+Check out our [Next.js deployment documentation](https://nextjs.org/docs/deployment) for more details.

nodes.title: 🔥 v1.0.0-beta.12
nodes.bodyText:
Fixed Issues
Closes #649  PR: #965 (Dropdown trigger issue on mobile 🚨)
Closes #969  PR: #965 (Dropdown trigger issue on mobile 🚨)
Closes #920 PR: #923
Closes #958 PR: #961
Features
PR: #934 Focus indicator added to shadow buttons
Refactors
PR: #966
📝 Description
New library version, v1.0.0-beta.12
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No): No

📝 Additional Information

commit.message: fix(react-popover): popover trigger on mobile device
feat(react-button): export press and pointer types
feat(docs-button): button events documentation
chore(docs): button onClick to onPress
fix: Tooltip trigger click event

Merge pull request #965 from tianenpang/fix/popover-trigger-mobile-device

fix(react-popover): popover trigger on mobile device
Merge branch 'next' of github.com:nextui-org/nextui into next

Merge pull request #966 from tianenpang/feat/button-events

feat(react-button): export types and events documentation

Merge pull request #974 from joaoGabriel55/fix/tooltip-trigger-click-event

Fix: Tooltip trigger click event

fix: process overflow visible #958 (#961)

* fix: process overflow visible.

* chore: updated process overflow hidden
disabled prop of Loading Buttons in StoryBook restricts color type visibility. (#913)

fix: added focus indicator to buttons that have a shadow (#934)

* fix: navbar link does not respect parent size

* fix: added focus indicator to buttons that have a shadow

Co-authored-by: Yuri Withowsky <yuri.withowsky@levelup.com.br>
Co-authored-by: Junior Garcia <jrgarciadev@gmail.com>

fix: fixed a11y role issue in progress bar component (#930)

* fix: navbar link does not respect parent size

* fix: fixed a11y role issue in progress bar component

Co-authored-by: Yuri Withowsky <yuri.withowsky@levelup.com.br>
Co-authored-by: Junior Garcia <jrgarciadev@gmail.com>

fix: fixed issues of clear button inside inputs #920 (#923)

* fix: fixed issues of clear button inside inputs #920

* chore: removed duplicate import

Co-authored-by: Junior Garcia <jrgarciadev@gmail.com>

Added eslint import/no-duplicates (#929)

* chore: added eslint import/no-duplicates

* chore: unified duplicate import

* fix: removed duplicate CSS import

Co-authored-by: Junior Garcia <jrgarciadev@gmail.com>
Merge branch 'main' of github.com:nextui-org/nextui into next

nodes.title: Fix: Tooltip trigger click event
nodes.bodyText:
Closes #968
📝 Description
When setting the trigger to click, the tooltip isn't displayed even if clicked.
🚀 New behavior
The StyledTooltipTrigger onClick event was not being triggered as expected, and changed it to onClickCapture in order to ensure that the event is correctly captured and handled.
The onClick event is a bubbling event, which means that it is triggered on the element that is clicked, and then it bubbles up the DOM tree to be handled by parent elements if needed. In contrast, the onClickCapture event is a capturing event, which means that it is triggered on the element's parent first, and then it propagates down the DOM tree to be handled by the element itself and any of its children.
By using the onClickCapture event instead of the onClick event, you can make sure that the event is captured and handled by the parent element before it reaches the element itself. This can be useful in cases where the parent element needs to handle the event before the child element does, or where the child element's behavior depends on the parent's handling of the event.
Thanks for the help @Isaac-alencar and @BrunoViveiros
📝 Additional Information
References:
https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/event-propagation-event-bubbling-event-catching-beginners-guide/

commit.message: fix: Tooltip trigger click event

nodes.title: fix(react-popover): popover trigger on mobile device
nodes.bodyText:
Closes #649
Closes #969
📝 Description
Popover triggers are not triggered on mobile devices, also affected by this issue is Dropdown.
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)
The issue is the wrong behavior of onPress in nextUIButtonProps 🤔 solved by passing onPress directly instead of handling OverlayTriggerState in onPress.

💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):
No
📝 Additional Information
Related to #953.

Note Based on next branch.

commit.message: fix(react-popover): popover trigger on mobile device

nodes.title: fix(docs-playground): dynamic live font styles
nodes.bodyText:
📝 Description
The theme of sandpack makes DynamicLive applied $sm font-size and line-height, which is the font-size and line-height of LiveCode.
As the live preview is not the $base font-size and $md line-height, it causes some content shift.

  
    
      nextui/apps/docs/src/components/sandpack/themes.ts
    
    
        Lines 29 to 34
      in
      66153ec
    
  
  
    

        
          
           typography: { 
        

        
          
             bodyFont: "var(--nextui-fonts-sans)", 
        

        
          
             monoFont: "var(--nextui-fonts-mono)", 
        

        
          
             fontSize: "var(--nextui-fontSizes-sm)", 
        

        
          
             lineHeight: "var(--nextui-lineHeights-sm)", 
        

        
          
           }, 
        
    
  


⛳️ Current behavior (updates)
Reapply the right font-size and line-height to InView.

💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):
No
📝 Additional Information
Before:

  
    
    

    before.webm
    
  

  

  


After:

  
    
    

    after.webm

commit.message: fix(docs-playground): dynamic live font styles

nodes.bodyText: Thanks man! @tianenpang 🙏🏻

nodes.title: fix(react-link): classnames mismatch during hydration
nodes.bodyText:
Closes #851
Closes #769
Closes #948
Closes #763
Closes #703 Navbar.Link mismatch only and separate fix #953
📝 Description
Dynamic linkBackgroundColor is implemented by using getTokenValue, but the getTokenValue can only get the value on the client-side, which causes the classnames mismatch between server-side and client-side.
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)

Apply colors dynamically based on pre-defined tokens.
Unify the color tokens into the color scheme.
Fix width: fit-content typo.

🚀 New behavior

Add the tokens required for the Link's background color.

// light theme
const colors = {
  ...rest,
  textLight: addColorAlpha(gray.gray900, 0.2),
  linkLight: addColorAlpha(blue.blue600, 0.2)
};

// dark theme
const colors = {
  ...rest,
  textLight: addColorAlpha(grayDark.gray900, 0.2),
  linkLight: addColorAlpha(blueDark.blue600, 0.2)
};
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):
No
📝 Additional Information

Note Based on next branch.

commit.message: fix(react-link): classname mismatch during hydration

@@ -4,42 +4,29 @@ description: NextUI in Next.js url: https://nextui.org/docs/nextui-plus-nextjs --- -# NextUI + Next.js +### Next.js 13 -NextUI is totally compatible with Next.js you just need to customize the \_app.jsx entry file to load the provider. +Next.js 13 introduces a new `app/` directory folder structure. By default it uses React Server Components. To use NextUI in those components, you need to convert them into client-side component by adding a
`'use client';` at the top of your file. +**NextUI only works in client-side components.** -Start your Next.js project with this example. + - - - - -### Server Render +### Next.js 12 and below -All Components of `@nextui-org/react` are compatible with **Server Render**. In fact, the page you see now is rendered by the server. +If you're not using the new app/ directory, there's no need to add the `'use client';` directive, you just need to customize the \_app.jsx entry file to load the provider. Here's an example project. -Server-side rendering (SSR) is the process of rendering web pages on a server and passing them to the browser (client-side), -instead of rendering them in the browser. SSR sends a fully rendered page to the client; the client's JavaScript -bundle takes over and enables the SPA framework to operate, the best option to use server side render in React.js is using Next.js. - -If you are worried about losing the advantages of a Single Page Application by implementing server-side rendering, you can use the `hybrid render` application. -Please read -the post from the Next.js team to learn more. - -In addition, for **server-side render** and web applications, we -strongly recommend that you read this famous post 7-principles-of-rich-web-applications from _Guillermo Rauch_. + - + -### Next.js -In Next.js framework, you need customization file `_document.js`, -please refer to Next.js document here -to create file `_document.js`. +### SSR Setup -Then we add the following code to the file: +In Next.js framework, you need to customize the `pages/_document.js` file. Then we add the following code to the file: ```jsx +// pages/_document.js + import React from "react"; import Document, { Html, Head, Main, NextScript } from "next/document"; import { CssBaseline } from "@nextui-org/react"; @@ -69,31 +56,69 @@ class MyDocument extends Document { export default MyDocument; ``` -Here's an example of what your `_document.js` file should look like: \_document.jsx. - -### Custom Server +### Provider Setup -In the custom server, also get the style set from function `CssBaseline.flush` as shown below. +NextUI needs to be wrapped in a provider to work properly. You need to set up the `NextUIProvider` at the root of your application. + +Go to `pages/_app.js` or `pages/_app.tsx` (create it if it doesn't exist) and add the following code: ```jsx -import React from "react"; -import ReactDOM from "react-dom/server"; -import { CssBaseline } from "@nextui-org/react"; -import App from "./app"; - -export default (req, res) => { - const app = ReactDOM.renderToString(); - const styles = CssBaseline.flush(); - const html = ReactDOM.renderToStaticMarkup( - - {styles} - -
- - - ); - res.end("" + html); -}; +// pages/_app.js + +// 1. import `NextUIProvider` component +import { NextUIProvider } from '@nextui-org/react' + +function MyApp({ Component, pageProps }) { + // 2. Use at the root of your app + return ( + + + + ) +} + +export default MyApp ``` + + +### Cutomizing theme + +If you intend to customise the default theme object to match your design requirements, you need to extend the `theme`. + +NextUI provides a `createTheme` function that deep merges the default theme with your customizations. + + +```jsx +// pages/_app.js + +// 1. Import `createTheme` +import { createTheme, NextUIProvider } from "@nextui-org/react" + +// 2. Call `createTheme` and pass your custom theme values +const theme = createTheme({ + type: "dark", // it could be "light" or "dark" + theme: { + colors: { + primary: '#4ADE7B', + secondary: '#F9CB80', + error: '#FCC5D8', + }, + } +}) + + +// 3. Pass the new `theme`` to the `NextUIProvider` +function MyApp({ Component, pageProps }) { + return ( + + + + ) +} + +export default MyApp +``` + +To futher customize the theme, please refer to the theming documentation.

nodes.title: fix(react-theme): white border of the focus ring
nodes.bodyText:
📝 Description
There is a white border in the animation of the focus ring caused by the outline property.
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)

Remove outline styles from the isFocusVisible variant.


💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):
No
📝 Additional Information

Note Based on next branch.

Take Radio's focus ring as an example, however, not all components have white border in the animation of the focus ring.
Before:

  
    
    

    before.webm
    
  

  

  


After:

  
    
    

    after.webm

commit.message: fix(react-theme): white border of the focus ring
fix(react-theme): no outline by default for focus ring

nodes.title: fix(react-dropdown): `onClose` and `onOpenChange` events
nodes.bodyText:
📝 Description

onClose is not executed.
onOpenChange executes twice when opening and ending with false.

⛳️ Current behavior (updates)

Solve multiple execution of onOpenChange by passing OverlayTriggerProps into useMenuTriggerState.

🚀 New behavior

Add handleClose to handle the close event.

💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):
No
📝 Additional Information

Note Based on next branch.

commit.message: fix(react-dropdown): onClose and onOpenChange

nodes.title: fix(react-table): layout shifting and table pagination
nodes.bodyText:
Closes #798
📝 Description

 Layout shifting during the page switch.
 Data is not updated when total configured.

⛳️ Current behavior (updates)

Increase placeholder units from $space$14 to $space$15.
Add dependency to setPage to be updated if necessary.


💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):
No
📝 Additional Information
For the improvement of #839.

Note Based on next branch.

nodes.title: Pr/839
nodes.bodyText:
Closes #798
📝 Description
Based on #839 but with the conflicts fixed

Update collection in TableContext when items change to update dependent components like Table.Pagination.

⛳️ Current behavior (updates)
Currently, the collection are only initialized once, so even if you add items the Pagination won't get additional pages. Only Table.Body uses the collections from props.
🚀 New behavior
When items prop of Table.Body changes, TableContext is updated and Pagination will update the number of pages accordingly.
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No): No

📝 Additional Information

commit.message: fix(table): update table context when items change
add test for context update and update snapshots
chore: fix conflicts with next branch
chore: snaps updated

files_with_diffs.patch:
@@ -0,0 +1,42 @@
+import {styled} from "@nextui-org/react";
+import {growCircles} from "@utils/animations";
+
+export const StyledSonarPulse = styled("div", {
+  position: "relative",
+  display: "inline-block",
+});
+
+export const StyledIconWrapper = styled("div", {
+  position: "relative",
+  width: "$$sonarSize",
+  height: "$$sonarSize",
+  textAlign: "center",
+  display: "flex",
+  justifyContent: "center",
+  alignItems: "center",
+  borderRadius: "50%",
+  background: "transparent",
+  zIndex: 2,
+});
+
+export const StyledSonarElements = styled("div", {
+  top: "50%",
+  left: "50%",
+  transform: "translate(-50%, -50%)",
+  overflow: "visible",
+  position: "absolute",
+  zIndex: -1,
+  size: "$$sonarSize * 4",
+});
+
+export const StyledSonarCircle = styled("div", {
+  $$circleSize: "calc($$sonarSize * $$factor)",
+  borderRadius: "50%",
+  position: "absolute",
+  width: "$$circleSize",
+  height: "$$circleSize",
+  top: "calc($$circleSize / 2 * -1)",
+  left: "calc($$circleSize / 2 * -1)",
+  animation: `6s linear infinite both $$playState ${growCircles} `,
+  animationDelay: "$$delay",
+});

@sun0day is attempting to deploy a commit to the **NextUI** Team on [Vercel](https://vercel.com).

A member of the Team first needs to [authorize it](https://vercel.com/git/authorize?team=NextUI&type=github&job=%7B%22headInfo%22%3A%7B%22sha%22%3A%222730e453a052428625da5f67a2e2de8aff74feed%22%7D%2C%22id%22%3A%22QmVsePiqCoxkXi9zRDPehUNgYL6oxvc6VoHdfEsARasT6D%22%2C%22org%22%3A%22nextui-org%22%2C%22prId%22%3A901%2C%22repo%22%3A%22nextui%22%7D).
@tianenpang this issue happen to you? I couldn't replicate it 🤔

> I can't reproduce it either 🤔 hey @sun0day please remove `node_modules` and cache then try again.
> 
> ```shell
> # Remove all node_modules and cache include sub-dirs
> find . '(' -name "node_modules" -o -name ".next" -o -name ".turbo" ')' -type d -prune -exec rm -rf '{}' +
> 
> # Install deps and build nextui
> yarn && yarn build:nextui
> 
> # Restart docs dev server
> yarn dev:docs
> ```

This error disappeared after cleaning cache and reinstalling dependencies.  But still, I think using circle depents is bad practice. We should avoid circle depents in case of some weird exceptions.
I agree with you, but I think this error may be caused by other issues 🤔 and for the circular dependency, it's possible to use the webpack plugin to detect it automatically.

I am pretty sure this origin reason is circular depents due to the exception description and my debug process. But the circular depents exception not always occurs, it depends the node_modules' physical topology,  `yarn` can't guarantee node_modules' topology always be the same every time you install or add new dependencies, especially when you host has node_modules cache.

And maybe we can  use eslint rule [import/no-cycle](https://github.com/import-js/eslint-plugin-import/blob/main/docs/rules/no-cycle.md) to discover the circular depends problems in dev stage.
Hey @sun0day I'll close this PR until we can reproduce it in a better way

nodes.bodyText:
I can't reproduce it either 🤔 hey @sun0day please remove node_modules and cache then try again.
# Remove all node_modules and cache include sub-dirs
find . '(' -name "node_modules" -o -name ".next" -o -name ".turbo" ')' -type d -prune -exec rm -rf '{}' +

# Install deps and build nextui
yarn && yarn build:nextui

# Restart docs dev server
yarn dev:docs

files_with_diffs.patch:
@@ -0,0 +1,47 @@
+const App = `import { Link, StyledLinkIcon, Spacer, Badge } from "@nextui-org/react";
+
+const CustomLink = () => {
+  return (
+    <StyledLinkIcon
+      className="custom-link-icon" 
+      width="1em" 
+      height="1em"
+      fill="none" 
+      viewBox="0 0 24 24"
+      shapeRendering="geometricPrecision"
+      stroke="currentColor" 
+      stroke-width="2" 
+      stroke-linecap="round" 
+      stroke-linejoin="round" 
+    >
+      <path d="M10 13a5 5 0 0 0 7.54.54l3-3a5 5 0 0 0-7.07-7.07l-1.72 1.71" />
+      <path d="M14 11a5 5 0 0 0-7.54-.54l-3 3a5 5 0 0 0 7.07 7.07l1.71-1.71" />
+    </StyledLinkIcon>
+  )
+}
+
+export default function App() {
+  return (
+    <>
+      <Link href="#">
+        "First solve the problem. Then, write the code." - Jon Johnson.
+      </Link>
+      <Spacer />
+      <Link href="#" isExternal color="success">
+        "First solve the problem. Then, write the code." - Jon Johnson.
+      </Link>
+      <Spacer />
+      <Link href="#" isExternal externalIcon={<CustomLink />} color="success">
+        "First solve the problem. Then, write the code." - Jon Johnson.
+      </Link>
+    </>
+  );
+}`;
+
+const react = {
+  "/App.js": App,
+};
+
+export default {
+  ...react,
+};

nodes.title: [BUG] - `disabled` prop of Loading Buttons in StoryBook restricts `color type` visibility.
nodes.bodyText:
Closes #878
📝 Description
This PR removes duplicate Spinner Button from Button->Loading StoryBook
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)
Duplicate Spinner Button inButton->Loading StoryBook
🚀 New behavior
No duplicate Spinner Button inButton->Loading StoryBook
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No): No
📝 Additional Information
No Comments

commit.message: [BUG] - Duplicate Spinner Button in StoryBook.
Removed `disabled` prop of each loading button for better color visibility.
Removed `disabled` prop of each loading button for better color visibility.

nodes.body:
**The latest updates on your projects**. Learn more about [Vercel for Git ↗︎](https://vercel.link/github-learn-more)

| Name | Status | Preview | Comments | Updated |
| :--- | :----- | :------ | :------- | :------ |
| **nextui-docs** | ✅ Ready ([Inspect](https://vercel.com/nextui-org/nextui-docs/F3mhrCDRg8RsLG1HrVSKx2hCdPpX)) | [Visit Preview](https://nextui-docs-git-refactor-upgrade-react-aria-packages-nextui-org.vercel.app) | 💬 [**Add your feedback**](https://vercel.live/open-feedback/nextui-docs-git-refactor-upgrade-react-aria-packages-nextui-org.vercel.app) | Nov 10, 2022 at 0:39AM (UTC) |
| **nextui-storybook** | ✅ Ready ([Inspect](https://vercel.com/nextui-org/nextui-storybook/6beXYqaScr8QpGcq3yLPTkwErAjw)) | [Visit Preview](https://nextui-storybook-git-refactor-upgrade-react-a-1f33bf-nextui-org.vercel.app) |  | Nov 10, 2022 at 0:39AM (UTC) |

The `@react-aria/focus` after [`v3.8.0`](https://github.com/adobe/react-spectrum/issues/3458) will break the app in strict-mode, it could be useful to specify in the docs that strict-mode should be disabled.
Or still keep the `"@react-aria/focus": "3.7.0"`, it works as usual.

nodes.title: fix(react-navbar)[#838]: firefox navbar issue
nodes.bodyText:
Closes #838
📝 Description
Firefox does not render expected


firefox in docs



firefox in storybook

⛳️ Current behavior (updates)

Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying

This issue comes from link.styles.ts > maxW: max-content

  
    
      nextui/packages/react/src/link/link.styles.ts
    
    
         Line 26
      in
      f85a569
    
  
  
    

        
          
           maxW: "max-content", 
        
    
  



I do not know exactly why firefox does render this way

🚀 New behavior

Please describe the behavior or changes this PR adds



firefox in docs



firefox in storybook



chrome in docs



chrome in storybook

set maxW: none !important where under the Navbar Item
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):

No. because same render result where chrome and other browsers.
📝 Additional Information
I thought diffrent way to disable maxW: max-content at link.styles.ts. but I think this way cause another issue. what do you think about it?

commit.message: fix: set under navbar-item elements max-width to none

nodes.title: chore: lint
nodes.bodyText:
📝 Description
Add commit hook for lint and commit msg.
commit-types: feat, feature, fix, refactor, docs, build, test, ci, chore
# above types and optional scope
git commit -m "type(scope?): subject"
Update npm scripts and dependencies

script: turbo
fix pnpm and package-manager version
up-version: turbo, tsup, storybook, jest and eslint

Separate prettier config
for prettier-cli formatting, the eslint-config-prettier will auto apply the .prettierrc.json
Storybook docs theme
apply the same light or dark theme as the canvas panel.
Contributing
correct the install command to pnpm i
Chore
add $schema for each json config file

💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):
No
📝 Additional Information
The packages, plop, scripts has been reformatted

commit.message: build: update scripts and dependencies; add husky, lint-staged and commitlint
feat: git commit hooks for formatting and msg check
chore: separate prettier config
chore: custom theme for storybook docs
chore: install command
chore: re-format and ignore scripts

nodes.body:
@tianenpang is attempting to deploy a commit to the **NextUI** Team on [Vercel](https://vercel.com).

A member of the Team first needs to [authorize it](https://vercel.com/git/authorize?team=NextUI&type=github&job=%7B%22headInfo%22%3A%7B%22sha%22%3A%220712e72c7456aee74d1ad1158c29e3e3b8e34894%22%7D%2C%22id%22%3A%22QmX4g8okq2dg5BEPDA8G3BJZtkbbu1AiWcNDimcDDn7Xim%22%2C%22org%22%3A%22nextui-org%22%2C%22prId%22%3A860%2C%22repo%22%3A%22nextui%22%7D).

nodes.bodyText: thank you so much! @tianenpang 🙏🏻

files_with_diffs.patch:
@@ -0,0 +1,16 @@
+const conventional = require("@commitlint/config-conventional");
+
+module.exports = {
+  extends: ["@commitlint/config-conventional"],
+  plugins: ["commitlint-plugin-function-rules"],
+  helpUrl: "https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.MD#commit-convention",
+  rules: {
+    ...conventional.rules,
+    "type-enum": [
+      2,
+      "always",
+      ["feat", "feature", "fix", "refactor", "docs", "build", "test", "ci", "chore"],
+    ],
+    "function-rules/header-max-length": [0],
+  },
+};

@@ -1,9 +1,9 @@
 root = true
 
 [*]
+indent_size = 2
+max_line_length = 100
 insert_final_newline = true
+trim_trailing_whitespace = true

-indent_size = 2
-trim_trailing_whitespace = true
-max_line_length = 80

@@ -0,0 +1,4 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env sh

+pnpm commitlint --config .commitlintrc.cjs --edit ${1}

nodes.title: Add Table.Button component
nodes.bodyText:
Add documentation for new component
Add test for new component
Fix some warnings in table test file
Closes #548
📝 Description
Added the possibility to add a button to the end of a table.
🚀 New behavior

💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):
No

commit.message:
Add Table.Button component
Add documentation for new component
Add test for new component
Fix some warnings in table test file

nodes.body:
Someone is attempting to deploy a commit to the **NextUI** Team on [Vercel](https://vercel.com).

A member of the Team first needs to [authorize it](https://vercel.com/git/authorize?team=NextUI&type=github&job=%7B%22headInfo%22%3A%7B%22sha%22%3A%225b467b4a6e25191cfa147aecd6d68d55417ed636%22%7D%2C%22id%22%3A%22QmPnRaGamdu6vti6XKV18XmVSJPxHYPgbkL1PcNvuoG3sN%22%2C%22org%22%3A%22nextui-org%22%2C%22prId%22%3A843%2C%22repo%22%3A%22nextui%22%7D).

**The latest updates on your projects**. Learn more about [Vercel for Git ↗︎](https://vercel.link/github-learn-more)

| Name | Status | Preview | Updated |
| :--- | :----- | :------ | :------ |
| **nextui-storybook** | ✅ Ready ([Inspect](https://vercel.com/nextui-org/nextui-storybook/8UQXdYLz8hSJTYVTzR1gxzmgwRDW)) | [Visit Preview](https://nextui-storybook-git-fork-hdanzo-feat-add-but-d012a4-nextui-org.vercel.app) | Oct 26, 2022 at 9:11PM (UTC) |
Hey @Hdanzo I appreciate you effort in sending this PR, however, the UI changes are made only by the `core` team since we discuss  the design and other stuff, sorry but I'll close it
Thank you for your contribution. But there is no need to add a `Table.Button`.  Just add a prop like `manually:boolean` to `Table` to control whether to manually trigger lazy loading.

Sure, but I don't think the loading is the challenge here, as far as I know you can't just add any child to the table or is there a way to do that so that you could have a button as the last row of the table?
What we are concerned about is adding a new component like `Table.Footer` to allow users nest their own component, not only a button. To solve #548, adding new props mentioned above is enough.
Okay, sure, I can work on adding it, are there any other criteria to take into account? I suppose the prop should be added to the `Table.Body` component

I imagine the new API will be like `<Table.Body bottom={ReactNode} />` 

`bottom` only shows when `Table.Body` scrolls to the bottom. What do you think @jrgarciadev
I am waiting for a reply to start working on this

files_with_diffs.patch:
@@ -26,6 +26,7 @@ import { Table } from '@nextui-org/react';
 - **Table.Body**: The body of the table and wrapper for the table's rows. Table body can be configured to display a loading indicator while data is being fetched.
 - **Table.Row**: Table rows can be navigated to using the arrow keys. Table rows support selection via mouse, touch, or keyboard. Clicking, tapping, or pressing the <kbd>Space</kbd> key anywhere in the row selects it.
 - **Table.Pagination**: Table pagination is used to navigate between pages of data.
+- **Table.Button**: Table button is used to display a button as the last row of the table.
 
 <Spacer y={2} />
 
@@ -113,7 +114,7 @@ import { Table } from '@nextui-org/react';
 
 <Playground
   title="Infinity Pagination"
-  desc="Table supports loading data asynchronously, and will display a progress loading set by the loadingState prop. 
+  desc="Table supports loading data asynchronously, and will display a progress loading set by the loadingState prop.
   It also supports infinite scrolling to load more data on demand as the user scrolls, via the `onLoadMore` prop."
   highlightedLines="38-40"
   files={tableContent.infinityPaginationTable}
@@ -155,6 +156,13 @@ import { Table } from '@nextui-org/react';
   files={tableContent.noAnimatedTable}
 />
 
+<Playground
+  title="Button"
+  desc="You can add a button to the `Table` by using `Table.Button`."
+  highlightedLines="11"
+  files={tableContent.buttonTable}
+/>
+
 <Spacer y={3} />
 
 ### APIs
@@ -268,6 +276,16 @@ import { Table } from '@nextui-org/react';
 
 <Spacer y={2} />
 
+#### Table Button Props
+
+| Attribute            | Type           | Description                                              | Default |
+| -------------------- | -------------- | -------------------------------------------------------- | ------- |
+| **children**         | `ReactNode`    | The content of the button                                | -       |
+| **show**             | `boolean`      | Display the button                                       | true    |
+| ...                  | `ButtonProps`  | Button component props                                   | -       |
+
+<Spacer y={2} />
+
 ### Table types
 
 #### Table children

nodes.title: Fix: Update TableContext when items change (fix #798)
nodes.bodyText:
Closes #798
📝 Description
Update collection in TableContext when items change to update dependent components like Table.Pagination.
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)
Currently the collection are only initialized once, so even if you add items the Pagination won't get additional pages. Only Table.Body uses the collections from props.
🚀 New behavior
When items prop of Table.Body changes, TableContext is updated and Pagination will update the number of pages accordingly.
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):
No
📝 Additional Information

commit.message: fix(table): update table context when items change
add test for context update and update snapshots

nodes.bodyText:
Hi @Knorrke sorry for the late review and the fix looks great.
I found that a similar issue still exist when Table.Pagination has total prop configured, it may be related to handlePageChanged or setPage.
Hi @jrgarciadev, thanks @Knorrke for the fix and we are ready to merge it to next. I'll fix the rest in separate PR.
Huge thanks! @Knorrke 🙏🏻

nodes.title: docs: Add nextjs related
nodes.bodyText:
📝 Description
The navbar.link caused the page refresh on Next.js, but we do not see this chapter related with Next.js Link in the docs. It spent me a lot of time to find what cause the page refresh.
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)
Add the navbar.link Next.js related doc.
🚀 New behaviorNo
Add the navbar.link Next.js related doc.
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):
No
📝 Additional Information

commit.message: docs: Add nextjs related

nodes.body:
@recallwei is attempting to deploy a commit to the **NextUI** Team on [Vercel](https://vercel.com).

A member of the Team first needs to [authorize it](https://vercel.com/git/authorize?team=NextUI&type=github&job=%7B%22headInfo%22%3A%7B%22sha%22%3A%22606bf82f2f4309765802c99a1f49b9b40e636159%22%7D%2C%22id%22%3A%22QmeiRoYDjK1YoGkunBjxFJPZLeErHdb6JCY4pUSnNdrbjH%22%2C%22org%22%3A%22nextui-org%22%2C%22prId%22%3A834%2C%22repo%22%3A%22nextui%22%7D).

**The latest updates on your projects**. Learn more about [Vercel for Git ↗︎](https://vercel.link/github-learn-more)

| Name | Status | Preview | Updated |
| :--- | :----- | :------ | :------ |
| **nextui-docs** | ✅ Ready ([Inspect](https://vercel.com/nextui-org/nextui-docs/8Mqx4qX4ARBsZez6KZ3WsFPJBt4h)) | [Visit Preview](https://nextui-docs-git-fork-recallwei-main-nextui-org.vercel.app) | Oct 20, 2022 at 2:36AM (UTC) |
| **nextui-storybook** | ✅ Ready ([Inspect](https://vercel.com/nextui-org/nextui-storybook/51PMAmFCz5au3pX2373mSFiYeiDn)) | [Visit Preview](https://nextui-storybook-git-fork-recallwei-main-nextui-org.vercel.app) | Oct 20, 2022 at 2:36AM (UTC) |

The code showcase needs some help.
Just use the `Next/Link` to wrapper the `<Navbar.Link />` Component.

files_with_diffs.patch:
@@ -0,0 +1,138 @@
+import {Layout, Box, AcmeLogo, Content} from "./common";
+
+const App = `import { Navbar, Link, Text, Avatar, Dropdown } from "@nextui-org/react";
+import { Layout } from "./Layout.js";
+import { AcmeLogo } from "./AcmeLogo.js";
+
+export default function App() {
+  const collapseItems = [
+    "Profile",
+    "Dashboard",
+    "Activity",
+    "Analytics",
+    "System",
+    "Deployments",
+    "My Settings",
+    "Team Settings",
+    "Help & Feedback",
+    "Log Out",
+  ];
+
+  return (
+    <Layout>
+      <Navbar isBordered variant="sticky">
+        <Navbar.Toggle showIn="xs" />
+        <Navbar.Brand
+          css={{
+            "@xs": {
+              w: "12%",
+            },
+          }}
+        >
+          <AcmeLogo />
+          <Text b color="inherit" hideIn="xs">
+            ACME
+          </Text>
+        </Navbar.Brand>
+        <Navbar.Content
+          enableCursorHighlight
+          activeColor="secondary"
+          hideIn="xs"
+          variant="highlight-rounded"
+        >
+          <Navbar.Link href="#">Features</Navbar.Link>
+          <Navbar.Link isActive href="#">
+            Customers
+          </Navbar.Link>
+          <Navbar.Link href="#">Pricing</Navbar.Link>
+          <Navbar.Link href="#">Company</Navbar.Link>
+        </Navbar.Content>
+        <Navbar.Content
+          css={{
+            "@xs": {
+              w: "12%",
+              jc: "flex-end",
+            },
+          }}
+        >
+          <Dropdown placement="bottom-right">
+            <Navbar.Item>
+              <Dropdown.Trigger>
+                <Avatar
+                  bordered
+                  as="button"
+                  color="secondary"
+                  size="md"
+                  src="https://i.pravatar.cc/150?u=a042581f4e29026704d"
+                />
+              </Dropdown.Trigger>
+            </Navbar.Item>
+            <Dropdown.Menu
+              aria-label="User menu actions"
+              color="secondary"
+              onAction={(actionKey) => console.log({ actionKey })}
+            >
+              <Dropdown.Item key="profile" css={{ height: "$18" }}>
+                <Text b color="inherit" css={{ d: "flex" }}>
+                  Signed in as
+                </Text>
+                <Text b color="inherit" css={{ d: "flex" }}>
+                  zoey@example.com
+                </Text>
+              </Dropdown.Item>
+              <Dropdown.Item key="settings" withDivider>
+                My Settings
+              </Dropdown.Item>
+              <Dropdown.Item key="team_settings">Team Settings</Dropdown.Item>
+              <Dropdown.Item key="analytics" withDivider>
+                Analytics
+              </Dropdown.Item>
+              <Dropdown.Item key="system">System</Dropdown.Item>
+              <Dropdown.Item key="configurations">Configurations</Dropdown.Item>
+              <Dropdown.Item key="help_and_feedback" withDivider>
+                Help & Feedback
+              </Dropdown.Item>
+              <Dropdown.Item key="logout" withDivider color="error">
+                Log Out
+              </Dropdown.Item>
+            </Dropdown.Menu>
+          </Dropdown>
+        </Navbar.Content>
+        <Navbar.Collapse>
+          {collapseItems.map((item, index) => (
+            <Navbar.CollapseItem
+              key={item}
+              activeColor="secondary"
+              css={{
+                color: index === collapseItems.length - 1 ? "$error" : "",
+              }}
+              isActive={index === 2}
+            >
+              <Link
+                color="inherit"
+                css={{
+                  minWidth: "100%",
+                }}
+                href="#"
+              >
+                {item}
+              </Link>
+            </Navbar.CollapseItem>
+          ))}
+        </Navbar.Collapse>
+      </Navbar>
+    </Layout>
+  );
+}`;
+
+const react = {
+  "/Content.js": Content,
+  "/Layout.js": Layout,
+  "/AcmeLogo.js": AcmeLogo,
+  "/Box.js": Box,
+  "/App.js": App,
+};
+
+export default {
+  ...react,
+};

   files={navbarContent.disableCollapseAnimation}
 />
 
+<Playground
+  asIframe
+  removeEntryContainer
+  title="Next.js Link"
+  previewHeight="600px"
+  iframeSrc="/examples/navbar/nextjs-link"
+  desc="If you are using [Next.js](https://nextjs.org) you can use `next/link` as a parent."

+/>

 <Spacer y={3} />
